content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Coal Mining Operation at (-15, -15)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (24.0, -15.0) extracting coal
- Wooden chest at (23.5, -16.5) storing coal (115 units)

###Copper Mining and Smelting Complex at (20, 20)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (20.0, 20.0) extracting copper ore
- Primary wooden chest at (20.5, 21.5) for initial ore collection
- Burner inserter at (21.5, 21.5) moving ore to middle chest
- Middle wooden chest at (22.5, 21.5) storing copper ore (380 units)
- Burner inserter at (23.5, 21.5) moving ore to furnace
- Stone furnace at (24.0, 20.0) for smelting
- Output wooden chest at (24.5, 17.5) storing copper plates (53 units)
- Burner inserter at (24.5, 18.5) moving plates to output chest

###Iron Mining Operation at (-14, 23)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-14.0, 23.0) extracting iron ore
- Wooden chest at (-14.5, 21.5) storing iron ore (583 units)

###Unused Furnace Group at (-10, 20)
Consists of:
- Stone furnace at (-11.0, 20.0)
- Stone furnace at (-9.0, 20.0)

ERROR TIPS

###Entity Placement Conflicts
- Before placing inserters or other entities, check if the target position is already occupied
- When placing inserters next to structures, ensure proper spacing and direction parameters

###Resource Management
- Monitor coal levels in inventory before attempting to refuel entities
- Ensure proper fuel distribution to all mining drills to prevent work stoppage

###Inserter Configuration Issues
- Ensure inserters have valid pickup and drop-off positions before placement
- Configure inserter directions properly to create functional item movement chains
- When placing inserters, verify that both source and destination entities are properly positioned

###Mining Operation Efficiency
- Keep mining drills fueled to maintain continuous operation
- Monitor chest inventory levels to prevent overflow or bottlenecks
